Reviews.Title: “Cheap but very simple - OK if you only need a bed close to Victoria”
Reviews.Author: Freiro
Reviews.Content: Very small room where you actually went through the bathroom to enter the room! Clean and OK. Quite OK breakfast. For GBP55 for a double room incl of breakfast it was OK. Walking distance to Victoria station. Don't plan to spend many minutes awake in the rooms, but OK if you only need a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Lets get things straight.....”
Reviews.Author: Colly_P7
Reviews.Content: You need to ask yourself a question before deciding to stay here....what is the purpose of my stay? I must admit, myself and my friend decided to stay here purely out of curiosity to see how bad it actually is. To be honest we were a little surprised. We expected worse. We had two priorities 1. Somewhere to sleep other than a park bench 2. Somewhere to wash. The hotel provided both. This hotel is located centrally in London and within Walking distance of Victoria station. Our room was tidy albeit not exactly spotlessly clean, it was fine for our needs and requirements. We didn't eat the food as we did not arise for the HOUR long sitting of breakfast. Do not expect anything from this hotel. Its a place to sleep and wash, that's all. Its a bit smelly also. Previous reviews stating it to be awful and ''you would be better sleeping on the street'' are a little over the top but that said, it is others opinions. Expect nothing from this place - This way you can only be a little happier than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever live in”
Reviews.Author: Sach G
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute from expact booking, said its 2.5 star hotel property but actually was one of the worst place i evn stayed in. The rooms was really dirty and you dont even feel sleeping on bed as you can smell the bed and room was not even clean from ages. As you enter get that horribally wrong smell in your nose. The condition of bathroom was also so bad. You dont even feel like to take a bath down their. Please please do not book this hotel at any point, even if you spend night at railstation or airport is better than this. I dont understand how come this hotel is still running, where is heath and safety ? Who approve this place are comfortable to stay for humans?

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Jana_von_Hijack
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there around new year 2009 and it was worst place I had ever stayed at. Room and bathroom was the smallest size possible, everything looked and felt dirty, mildew was mainly in bathroom and also around window in room. I got really sick in London and I rather took the risk and went to walk in the city than to stay in the bed, how bad I felt about the state of the room.. The only PRO is walking distance to the Victoria station and longer walk to the city centre. CONTRAs are zillions but MAINLY: - dirty room with mildew - poor breakfast (you get 2 slices of toast bread + jam/butter and choose between coffee or tea, + small glass of juice) - very expensive price in comparison with the state of the hotel.. it should be listed as a HOSTAL not hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small cozy room”
Reviews.Author: Ryan074
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night on a last minute booking. The room was really small, booked a double room and it was two beds pushed together to make one big one, and that was about there was space for in the room with the bed in a corner basically with only a couple feet space from the bed to the walls. It was perfect for just one night, had own shower and shared toilet. Room was clean, shower was fairly clean, but cant complain for the price we paid. It is about a 5-10min walk from the Victoria tube station and was easy to find. We over slept and the allowed to check out late with no extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hotel - Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockChick14
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Vegas hotel for 2 nights when we were staying in London. It was good for sleeping in but it wasn't good for sitting around. They said on their website that you would be greeted by our employees, but the employees would rather sit with their feet up talking on their mobile phone. The lampshades are ripped, the toilet seat is broken, the shower drain is full of hair, wallpaper is ripped off like something was there but isn't anymore. I don't think they even care if they get bad reviews they just want money. If I had to stay there more than 2 days I would have went mad !!!!! I WOULD NOT stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisDerry2010
Reviews.Content: It is not a great hotel - The only thing going for this is the location, 3-4 minute walk from Victoria Station and and nice area, even at night. Why pink everywhere? All the areas and rooms are pink walls and patterned carpets that look like they belong in a 70s sitcom. I stayed with my daughter in a twin room which measured app 12x6 feet, the toilet was about 2x4 and the shower was just awful, filling up with water (did they ever clean the hair trap, I doubt it?) and not sealed around properly. It was Ok to sleep as we only came back after long days of walking and shows, but you definitely wouldn't want to spend any length of time in it. i don't know if this 'hotel' even checks their reviews or cares but it really wouldn't take much to tidy it up a bit and clean/paint. Even the light shade in the room was ripped and the furniture looked like it had been salvaged from a skip.

Reviews.Title: “City centre, but small and old”
Reviews.Author: frishki
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something cheap (of course), but still with a private bathroom. The cheapest I could find at the time was Vegas Hotel on Warwick Way, just 5 minutes of walk to the Victoria Train Station from where I could go anywhere, plus it has the fastest and best connection to Gatwick Airport with Gatwick Express. Hotel itself is pretty small and cramped, especially the room I had. It fit single bed and just enough free space to walk beside it to the "bathroom". Well, bathroom isn't for the claustrophobic people, that's for sure and when you open the door of the bathroom, you're greeted by the shower, but now shower booth. Since I'm pretty tall, it was pretty challenging to shower myself properly since I didn't have the space to bend and I couldn't run the water for longer than 30 seconds so I don't flood the room. Since I spent only the nights in the hotel, I didn't care that much about it, but if I would have to spend the whole day in there, I might go insane. Wi-fi is available for 3 GBP, but the signal in my room wasn't the best, so here and there I would lost the connection. Plus, the wall sockets in my room weren't functional, so I had to charge my phone in the one just outside my room door. All in all, I wasn't the happiest camper ever with the choice, but it did its job.

Reviews.Title: “BE PREPARED, We would definately not recomend this Hotel, even for budget travellers like us”
Reviews.Author: uninpressed
Reviews.Content: We prebooked this Hotel for our last 4 days in London.( after traveling around the UK for 2.5weeks) Read all the reviews, gee, what do people expect for the price. and thought "It's only a place to sleep".Location great, price o*k for our budget, plus breakfast included. It's a hit or miss!!. How wrong were we to book, definately a Miss. Backpackers accommodation would have been on par. In a Nutshell, on entering the premises unpleasant smell, Male Reception staff, Robotic and rude with answers to questions,Triple check your booking confirmation well before your arrival date.(we had our confirmation with us, but on arrival was told our cr card was canceled and email was sent--( cr card was good and email was not received) Managed ,to get a room for 2 nights, (not the type we had booked) after pleading with " Robot " In summary, Our room had a mouldy/damp odour,carpet dirty, mattress lumpy, bathroom area needed major maintenance.Daily clean towels were not delivered. On speaking to a young Brazillan Couple at breakfast, who had spent their 1st night at the hotel, they asked us what our room was like, they were appalled at the condition of their room, they showed me their entrance, on opening the door you actually stepped onto the shower/toilet floor to get into the room,(toilet seat was broken and on the floor) which was also same condition as ours. They had booked and paid for 5 nights. On leaving, after 3 long rings of the service bell and no attendance, we gladly threw the keys on the desk. Your Choice

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, awful - I wouldn't stay even if there was no charge”
Reviews.Author: GFMG10
Reviews.Content: I planned to stay for 2 nights on a business trip, the bulk of hotels were booked due to the Chelsea Flower Show. When you opened the door to the bedroom you stepped into the shower cubicle!!! The carpets were so dirty I needed to keep my shoes on. The bedding was dirty, smelled and was very old. I used a clean towel to lie on top of. The receptionist was more interested in talking on his phone than booking me in. I was 3 floors up with bags and there is no lift. I didn't even try the breakfast and only stayed 1 night, I checked out as soon as possible. DONT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “dirty dirty dirty”
Reviews.Author: gutspaddy
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights its, smelly and gruby ,soon as you opened your door you walk straight into a shower ,then another door into the smallest room you can think off say a broom cupboard,bed was dirty and one off the beds sank in the middle like a boat,terrible place never ever would dream off staying here again ,not even for free,

Reviews.Title: “Expencive, bad smelling room”
Reviews.Author: Frk-Lillehagen
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom spent 2 nights at this hotel, and we did not like this hotel. The location is good, only a short walk from Victoria Station, but that is where the good things stops. The room was small, was painted in an ugly pink color and the smell of sewage is bad! The window could not be closed, so it was blowing cold all the time. The reseptionist said" in case of a fire, the firedepartement should be able to get in". Well, I have slept at a few other hotels in the UK and never had that problem before. The breakfast, that was included in the price, was bad, unless you want to eat only cornflakes, and orange marmelade. So if you have the option to pay for the breakfast, Don't! Even though it is close to the train station, it is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A complete joke to call it a hotel”
Reviews.Author: spatin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night because our flight was cancelled due to the snow and we needed to stay near Victoria and there wasn't anything else available (well, were there a few other hotels that seemed even worse than this one). The receptionist told us there wasn't a triple room available so we had to book 2 rooms but I was so afraid to stay alone with my son in one room that my husband didn't go to the other room and stayed with us. I don't understand how the authorities don't close these filthy hovels. In case of a fire I don't believe anyone can survive because everything is so small that 2 side-by-side bedroom doors can't be opened at the same time. The bathroom was a joke, we actually have to pass the shower to reach the toilet, and while seated in the toilet our feet have to remain inside the shower. Bed covers haven't seen water in recent months or years. Sheets and towels seemed clean. We didn't take the breakfast as we left very early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “we had no problems!!!”
Reviews.Author: neweth
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed at the vegas hotel for 3 nights, from 15th november to 18th. we orginally booked for 4 nights, but decided to leave the night before we were due to check out to get the night train home! nothing to do with the hotel, we had done everything we wanted to do, so thought we would avoid the rush in the morning! we stayed in room 16, on the top floor, a double room. the room itself is fairly small, and so is the toilet, but we were only there to sleep so it was ok! the room and the bathroom was clean, we had our bed made everyday, and clean towels, toilet roll added! the shower took a while to get hot sometimes, but this wasnt an issue! the only one thing we didnt really like was the bedding, its a blanket, a sheet, and then like a throw! would have been much better if it was just a normal duvet! but still it was allright! as we were on the top floor, we had to go up 6 flights of stairs, but i didnt complain, it was excersise! :) ha! the staff ( we only saw two guys the whole time) were friendly enough, and helpful, said they could find places for us if we needed to no where to go! the hotel itself is situated in a GREAT area!!!! there is everything around that you need, lots of shops, takeaways, resturaunts, and it is very close to victoria station! this made our stay so much easier! we didnt go down to breakfast at all, so i cant comment on that! but if you want a fry up or anything other than cereal and toast, there is plenty of cafes around so you wont have trouble! overall i would reccoment this place, if your looking for luxury then your not going to find it here, but if your just looking for somewhere to put your head down after a long day of sightseeing, then this is the place! fairly priced, clean, warm, everything you need at your doorstep!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great experiance for a London weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bihnebih
Reviews.Content: I slept at Vegas hotel for 1 night just last week. I payed Â£55 for a twin bed room and got what I payed for- clean sheets, towels, soaps, ok breakfast and nice staff. We arrived before check-in and were allowed to leave our bags until we came back from our London bus tour. Yes, it is a small-roomed hotel but not at all bad. We also had a TV in the room that was almost new and worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: patty51459
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, I thought this little hotel was wonderful. The bath was "unique", and after all, we were only there to sleep! Will stay there again.......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but shabby”
Reviews.Author: budgetstayer
Reviews.Content: This has a nerve calling itself a hotel, it is a basic Bed & Breakfast. Chosen for it's location only, the one thing I can't argue is the price. I booked through a booking agency and it was Â£39/nigh B&B. Rooms are tiny and seen better days, the bathroom was so compact I could literally touch all walls while sitting on the loo! The shower was ok, but no excuse for mouldy shower curtain. Breakfast was cornflakes and some toast, but at the price I wouldn't have expected much. Staff fairly friendly. The best thing was that it was about a 5-10 minwalk with luggage from Victoria station.

Reviews.Title: “Small, very small... but cheap and well centred in Victoria.”
Reviews.Author: Leviwosc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at November 13th 2009 at the hotel. We could only check in at 02:00 pm, while we had already arrived at Victoria Coach Station at 10:00 am after a very long and bumpy ride with a Terravision bus from London Stansted Airport. The young man at the reception told us we couldn't check in, yet. We could leave our luggage in the dining room already though. I didn't feel comfortable leaving my luggage in the dining room and decided to keep wearing my 9 kg backpack the rest of the morning through London. My friend who had a much heavier suitcase had no choice to trust these people. Finally we could check in at 02:00 pm. Both, my friend and I were surprised we were expected to pay for the room in advance. We got room 10 which is at the first floor. My friend could hardly enter the room with her suitcase, because the door is so narrow. I had to enter the room sideways myself (but I'm a big bloke). We stood directly in a 'hall' with at our left hand a small door to the toilet and at the right a shower base which was only separated from the 'hall' by a yellowish shower curtain. The door right in front of us lead to the actual bedroom. This door, with door-spring, was as small as the primary door to the 'room'. Our bedroom measured 2 x 4 metres. The beds were placed against the sides standing opposite from each other. Like the entire interior of the hotel, the room was painted in salmon pink and off-white. The paint job had been done quite poorly and made me think of an average student room. I can not confirm the accusations of mouldy and/or dirty rooms. The room got vacuumed every afternoon and the beds were made again, when we came back to our room, tired of walking all day long. The breakfast downstairs in the dining room, which seems to be a cellar to me. I assume the term 'continental breakfast' is chosen very consciously by the manager. It allows him to keep the breakfast very light and sober and therefore cheap. I was surprised to see that the cleaning lady was preparing the toast for the guests. It makes me think that the staff of the hotel is one family running the hotel. The staff was polite towards me and my friend, although they weren't very conversational. In my opinion it wouldn't be a bad idea if these people attend a course customer contact. It was nice that the reception was manned for 24 hours per day, though. Finally I have to make a remark about the so called walking distance. Of course it's great to have your hotel located near the stations in Victoria. But a walking distance of only 3 minutes is just not true! With a regular pass it will take you at least 10 minutes to reach Victoria Coach Station and certainly 15 minutes to reach Victoria Train Station and Victoria Underground Station. I'm personally not a fast walker, so it took me even some more time. But you can only reach the Victoria Coach Station in 3 minutes if you're a very well trained runner. At the end, I think it's not too bad for the price we've paid. Yes the hotel is quite dodgey and dull but don't expect a 5* room for a 2* price. If you want the service and the style, than you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dreadful place.”
Reviews.Author: Corracrin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dangerous in terms of health and safety and fire regulations. Everything was filthy and the smell of sewage and blocked drains was atrocious. Our one night was a nightmare because of the stink and the ground-in filth. In the event of fire, dozens will be killed. This hotel is a fire hazard and death trap. Overall this is the most frightful place I have ever been. Stay well away.

Reviews.Title: “clean, but ugly as hell, and smaller than mine toilet”
Reviews.Author: tonci11
Reviews.Content: I was attracted by the great location, very close to Victoria station. But other than that, I would never want to go there ever again!!! I mean, the receptionist was ok, helpful and smiling a lot, but everything else was... I was speachless for a minute. My room was on the 1st floor. I opened the door and found myself in a toilet. Under the shower. Because first you enter the bathroom, and only later you open another door - and go to the room. I must admit, it was clean, but smelling strange. Humidity and worn out furniture, no closet... It was ok for a night, but nothing longer. But everytime you want to go out, you have to pass through this bloody toilet and shower. Holding one door, staying in the middle of the shower, and grabbing the other door, sometimes with the luggage. Absolutely horrific! In total - they won't see me ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “MONEY WELL SPEND”
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Vegas hotel was great. Location was perfect. Room was small but was clean and bright, we booked Twin basic room and we were lucky to get room with toilet and shower. 24hr hot water. Canâ€™t ask for more, Breakfast was basic continental which was ok. Staffs were helpful. Overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, unhygienic and revolting”
Reviews.Author: CAB31Manchester
Reviews.Content: Saw three rooms. One on top floor not bad, small but relatively clean. Next door had a smell of blocked drains permeating the bedroom. We were moved to the basement room which was absolutely filthy but didn't smell. There was thick dust and filthy walls, the shower curtain was covered in black mold, the fan in the shower roomwas clogged with filth the bedding was torn and the staff unhelpful and rude. If the rooms are that dirty we couldn't stand the thought of how dirty the kitchen (a place guests don't see) might be. We left without risking breakfast. They ask for payment on arrival, had they not, we would have left.

Reviews.Title: “horrible horrible stay away!”
Reviews.Author: eric98277
Reviews.Content: what can i say about this hotel? anything? peole have said the good bonus is its near the station, well its a ten minute walk normally but when you are draging suitcases its more like half an hour. the staff are rude unfriendly, i asked for them to call for a cab for me and they said `we cant do that`. they made me drag my suitcases up 5 floors after telling me the original room on the first floor is booked... i had a three year old baby with me too. ridiculous. the carpet next to the door is rotting away and coverered in mould as are the curtains. the hotel stinks of curry coming from the reception. it may be budget ish priced but for an extra tenner you can get 100% better service from any hotel nearby. the internet is crap, i used my laptop it constantly disconnected. worst hotel ever avoid it like the plague

Reviews.Title: “Now this place is small!!”
Reviews.Author: Jags12us
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice enough and the internet was only a pound a day. But I could barely get my suitcase and myself in the room at the same time. The bed was not quite 6' long and if I was any taller, I couldn't have fit. The bathroom is not as large as a small cubboard. It was less than 24" across. And maybe 5' long. That included the shower! No radio, or cable. No remote for the TV either. Not even a chair to sit down. Kind of noisy in the morning as well. I tried to goto breakfast, but the place was always packed and when I went back, it was picked clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfull.”
Reviews.Author: karlofandango
Reviews.Content: Ok ill be completely honest with you its not the best Hotel in the world but we payed just Â£16 per night per person bed and continental breakfast and pretty much got what you would expect for that price.The rooms themself were on the small side but were basic enough and had enough space to do what you needed to do ie washing and sleeping.They were fairly clean but the ceiling did have a big mouldy patch on it,but lets be honest how many people would actually go and touch the ceiling anyway!!Breakfast was cornflakes and toast with tea or coffee so pretty standard really.The hotel location was fine only being about 5 min walk from Victoria Coach/Train staions.We actually managed to spend most of our time in London without using the tube as the hotel was so central to everything. I would say dont be put off by the negative comments on here as im sure some people just like to moan about everything-they expect 5* rooms ect for 2* prices when im afraid that just isnt going to happen.We would and probably will stay here again as its like the tital says CHEAP AND CHEERFULL

Reviews.Title: “oh my god”
Reviews.Author: CornishUk
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel for one night. ONE NIGHT TOO MANY!! Dirty is a good way to sum it up, net curtains were black with mould the bed sheets had stains on them, the bathroom had moulds growing i have never before seen in my life!! I am very suprised we did not get sick from staying here. Don't risk it!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Debori
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in this hotel recently and we considered it value for money Room was small but clean and quiet.(high celling) Bathroom was tiny but functional. Central heating was fine. Breakfast was included, basic but good enough to keep you going until lunch time. Coffee was ordinary, but you can have as much cereal and toast as you want - just ask for it! Decoration Work was going on during our stay,( we could smell fresh paint in our rooms to) Felt very secure with 24 hour desk & helpful staff. Overall, you get what you pay for and we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: angfabio
Reviews.Content: We had booked out accommodation online, via the Vegas hotel website about 4 weeks before our arrival date. just to make sure, although i had written printed confirmation, i had called the hotel to confirm our booking and was told all was fine. we arrived at the hotel at 3am to then be told that our booking was canceled due to our credit card not working (it was working fine after calling the bank). I had then said but we have cash to pay for our stay. They didn't care, they wouldn't give us a room. we had to find a place to stay at 3am in the morning. Shocking service, i would never recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “not that good”
Reviews.Author: kezminda
Reviews.Content: its worth about a 1 or 2*, the staff, dont speak to you, not friendly at all. the rooms are very very small, you can only walk around one side of the bed. we didnt even bother getting up for breakfast as we knew it would be rubbish! The only good things about it is the ideal location 5 minutes away from victoria station, and that they onyl charge Â£1 each to leave your bags for hte day if you want to go siteseeing etc on your last day. when we went there was builders on the building next door, so got woke up by all the noise. this is not there fault however i feel it would of been appropriate to of warned us prior to our visit. The room is very old fashinoned, dirty walls, ripped curtains and it can go on.. not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Gautamghosh
Reviews.Content: I was allocated to room that is literally a converted garden shed. It had an worn out ensuite bath/toilet the size of a postage stamp. The bed was OK, but the room was just plain shabby. I have stayed in loads of hotels in London of varying quality and would seriously advise people to stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Please please please stay away!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rubyslipperjo
Reviews.Content: This has to be the most filthy hotel in the world!!!! We checked in on Sept 3 and within 10 mins had walked right back out, with a smell stuck in my nose so bad I was actually retching as I walked away, the rooms are tiny to say the least, filthy dirty with mould and mildew on the walls and ceilings and the curtains are held upright by the dirt and mould, I am not exaggerating when I say how dirty it is, to the extent that I am actually reporting them to Westminster Council on health and safety and environmental grounds, the receptionist tried his hardest to get us to stay in other hovels they call rooms and then in his desperation even offered to wash the curtains. To add insult to injury as we had initialy checked in and decided to turn tail and look for somewhere half decent we lost out money, so be warned. STAY AWAY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Inga1980
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st time in london i was really impressed by staff who welcomed us with a smile and helped us to carry our bages. friend of mine recommended vegas hotrel. i Stayed in room #12 i was surprised by room size. next day i thought of checking out my wife was not happy with room size .. we checked few hotels in victoria and found out all hotels room size were same . we asked receptionist if he can change us to biger room he showed us 2rooms and all room size were same. last day we were checking out at 5:30am we requested staff if we can have early breakfast he said 5:30am is too early than too he brought tea to our room at 5:00am. We'll be back and will recommend to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Horrible , Horrible Horrible filfthy broken grubby !”
Reviews.Author: lechatnoir7
Reviews.Content: The worst , ever ! the beds were too short to stretch out in and I'm only 5 feet seven inches tall.. the radiator was at the foot of the bed. They were asked to give us a wake-up call at 5:15 I even asked them to put a sign on the board so they would't forget they did forget..almost cost us a bunch ...... My son said that it was like being in a dungeon... worst night ever ! Do not go there !

Reviews.Title: “well below standard!!”
Reviews.Author: londonlondonbaby
Reviews.Content: this was the worst B & B i've ever stayed in! very cramped. very dirty and seems as though bed covers are not washed or changed between guest check-ins! the state of the rooms are just not up to scratch. very dusty along the skirtng boards. i wouldnt recommend this B & B to anyone really. there are loads more B & B's around the area which i'm sure are much better. for the Â£40 i paid, i expected a lot better!!! wont b goin back there for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Barely ok...”
Reviews.Author: J&S_Singapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed a 'good' 4 nights at Vegas. For its location the pricing seems ok. Besides it appears that only this hotel is available for our tight schedule. Bit disappointed that the facitilites fall short of expectation. There were no phones nor radio and we have to borrow water heater to boil water. Area is clamped and we do not know that bathroom does not come with wc. Also one of the bedsheet was badly damped (dun know why). There was no fan so we have to leave window open, and the noise can be bothering as our unit faces Warwick Way. London is a wonderful place but reckon we would try other hotels nearby for a break.. J&S, Singapore

HotelInfo.Name: Vegas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 104 Warwick Way | Victoria, London SW1V 1SD, England
